summary: The concept of "school medicine" pertains to the health sector within the European Union, focusing on the provision of medical services and health education in educational settings. It encompasses regulatory frameworks that govern the health and well-being of students, ensuring that school environments promote physical and mental health. EU legal documents may address the integration of health policies within educational institutions, emphasizing preventive care, access to healthcare professionals, and the importance of health literacy. By establishing guidelines and standards, the EU aims to enhance the overall health outcomes of children and adolescents in schools, thereby fostering a healthier future generation.
